page.title: 07Warkton, Kettering.
page.content: From the A43(T) road there is a wonderful view of the village of Warkton set well above the valley of the River Ise just 2 miles north-east of Kettering. It is a beautiful place surrounded by meadowland with sheep and dairy cattle often present. Many trees are evident which enhance the area enormously. On the ridge above the village an avenue of lime trees leads towards Boughton House. The stone cottages are mostly thatched or have Collyweston tile roofs; many have small latticed windows and some have strengthening bolts, plates and girders. There are a few 20th. century buildings which blend well into the local scene. Rigorous planning requirements have demanded that they too should be of stone.
